comments.text: *** Bug 656897 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Okay, this is my guess:

If there's no URI-handler installed, the auto-linker instead finds the email address and makes that the link; the `:' just gets included as part of the email address.

> Do you have xmpp clients on those machines ?

I do, but it turns out that Psi (Windows) apparently doesn't register xmpp in the operating system.

This makes me wonder why Thunderbird still tries to linkify it; shouldn't it be handled just like any other unknown URI scheme?

(Pointers to the code that is involved here would be welcome)
